agents.name: Calculation Agent
agents.description: Agent #1: can perform basic mathematical operations like add, subtract, multiply, and divide two numbers.

agents.name: Web Browser Agent
agents.description: Agent #2: capable of browsing the web and extracting information

agents.name: Web Page Fetcher
agents.description: Agent #3: capable of querying a specific webpage to read its content

agents.name: File Analyser Agent
agents.description: Agent #4: capable of understanding complex documents,⚠️⚠️ Is very slow on the online version, is better to use locally

agents.name: Google Documents Agent
agents.description: Agent #5: Will save the conversation to a new doc on Google Docs,⚠️⚠️  Due to complex credentials management it is currently unasable on the streamlit version and will be replaced by day 1 Calculations Agent

agents.name: Git Repository Analysis Agent
agents.description:
Agent #6: Analyzes the history, structure, and content of a public Git repository.

First, provide a Git clone link (e.g., https://github.com/Axaled/LinkedIn-Agents-Challenge.git).

Then, the following actions are available:
- list_branches_tool
- list_tags_tool
- list_commits_tool
- get_latest_commit_tool
- get_file_contents_tool
- get_diff_tool
- search_files_tool
- get_tree_tool
- get_last_diff_tool

agents.name: Pool Quotation Agent
agents.description:
Agent #7: Introducing Scripted Agents logic, you can now force the agents into predefined steps to retrieve values, 
 this is an arbitrary POC with fictional pool quotation

agents.name: Custom Agent
agents.description:
Agent #8: Custom  agent is for demo purpose only, your can find the code on Github https://github.com/Axaled/LinkedIn-Agents-Challenge.git 
 This will redirect you to agent #8 Pool quotation agent

agents.name: Mail sender Agent
agents.description:
Agent #9: Can send emails from your own personnal account 
 will not work with pro account, I am not responsible for what the LLM sends, use this carefully
